name: src/flowDraw.js
flowCanvas
description: The cansvas on which the atoms are placed.

name: ctrlDown
description: A flag to indicate if ctrl or commd pressed

name: ctrlKey
description: Ctrl event key

name: cmdKey
description: Cmmd event key

name: vKey
description: V event key

name: cKey
description: C event key

name: openTopMenu
description: Checks if menu is open and changes class to trigger hiding of individual buttons

name: closeTopMenu
description: Closes main menu on background click or on button click if open

name: init
description: Runs once when the program begins to initialize variables.

name: onWindowResize
description: Handles the window's resize behavior when the browser size changes.

name: animate
description: Animation loop. Runs with every frame to draw the program on the display.

name: src/js/alwaysOneFreeInput.js
howManyInputPortsAvailable
description: Computes the number of inputs which are curently available on a target atom.

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should have it's number of inputs computed.

name: deleteEmptyPort
description: Deletes one free input from an atom which has more than one free input available.

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should have one input deleted (if there are more than two free).

name: findHighestInput
description: Finds the highest number input currently used by this atom

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should be inspected for inputs.

name: addOrDeletePorts
description: Adds or deletes inputs from a target atom until there is exactly one input available.

params.name: target
params.description: The atom which should have it's number of inputs adjusted.

name: src/js/BOM.js
BOMEntry
description: This class defines a BOMEntry object which is used to define one entry in a bill of materials.

name: constructor
description: The constructor returns a new blank BOMEntry object.

name: BOMitemName
description: The name of the item.

name: numberNeeded
description: The number of this item needed.

name: costUSD
description: The cost of one of this item in USD.

name: source
description: A link to where to purchase the item.

name: totalNeeded
description: The total number of this item needed for this part. Should this be removed in favor of  forcing the parts to be modeled? Probably nobody would bother.

name: extractBomTags
description: Computes and returns an array of BOMEntry objects after looking at the tags of a geometry.

params.name: geometry
params.description: The geometry which should be scanned for tags.

name: src/js/display.js
Display
description: This class handles writing to the 3D preview display. Large parts of this class are copied directly from JSxCAD.

name: constructor
description: The constructor run to create the new display. It seems to run with each refresh which doesn't seem right to me.

name: datasets
description: An array which contains the data to be respresented in 3D.

name: displayedGeometry
description: The last shape that was sent to the display. Used for switching to wireframe.

name: displayGrid
description: An Flag to indicate if the grid on the XY plane should be displayed.

name: gridScale
description: Grid scale to keep track of zoom scale

name: axesCheck
description: A flag to indicate if the axes should be displayed.

name: wireDisplay
description: A flag to indicate if the frame should be displayed in wire frame.

name: solidDisplay
description: A flag to indicate if the solid should be displayed.

name: targetDiv
description: The HTML div object targeted to add the display to.

name: threeMaterial
description: The default material used if nothing is set

name: colorToRgbMapping
description: A list of colors to RGB mappings.

name: controls
description: The controls which let the user pan and zoom with the mouse.

name: scene
description: The threejs scene to which things should be added to show up on the display.

name: axesHelper
description: The three js Axes that appears on the grid

name: renderer
description: The three js webGLRendere object which does the actual rendering to the screen.

name: checkBoxes
description: Creates the checkbox hidden menu when viewer is active

name: baseLog
description: This function is intended to calculate the base log of two numbers and round it to an integer

name: dist3D
description: This function is intended to calculate the 3d distance between object and camera

name: makeMaterial
description: This function is intended to allow for materials. It is currently not used and can probably be deleted.

params.name: material
params.description: A string to define the material type.

name: writeToDisplay
description: Writes a shape to the 3D display. Expecting a threejs geometry.

params.name: shape
params.description: A jsxcad geometry data set to write to the display. Computation is done in a worker thread

name: zoomCameraToFit
description: Zooms the camera to fit target bounds on the screen.

params.name: bounds
params.description: An array of some sort...this comment should be updated.

name: setGrid
description: Scales grid if object loaded is already zoomed out farther than initial grid tier or if zoomed in or out

name: makeGrid
description: Redraws the grid with update values on render

name: removeGrid
description: Removes the grid with update values on checked box

name: toRgb
description: Converts the tag to an RGB value.

name: setColor
description: Sets the the color of the threejs mesh.

name: merge
description: Merges two objects.

name: setMaterial
description: Sets the material properties of the threejs material.

name: buildMeshMaterial
description: Constructs a new threejs mesh material based on the properties in the tags.

name: updateDisplayData
description: Clears the display and writes a threejs geometry to it.

params.name: threejsGeometry
params.description: A threejs geometry to write to the display. Generated from the worker thread.

name: onWindowResize
description: Handles resizing the 3D viewer when the window resizes.

name: render
description: Runs regularly to update the display.

name: src/js/githubOauth.js
GitHubModule
description: This function works like a class to sandbox interaction with GitHub.

name: src/js/globalvariables.js
GlobalVariables
description: This class defines things which are made available to all objects which import it. It is a singlton which means that each time it is imported the same instance is made available so if it is written to in one place, it can be read somewhere else.

name: constructor
description: The constructor creates a new instance of the Global Variables object.

name: canvas
description: The canvas object on which the atoms are drawn.

name: c
description: The 2D reference to the canvas object on which the atoms are drawn.

name: secretTypes
description: An array of all of the secret types of atoms which can not be placed by the user.

name: runMode
description: A flag to indicate if the program is running in run mode (ie a shared link).

name: gitHub
description: The github object which is used to interact with GitHub.

name: fork
description: A flag to indicate if the project is a fork.

name: circleSegmentSize
description: The size (in mm) of segments to use for circles.

name: ask
description: A worker thread which can do computation.

name: render
description: The threejs renderer which displays things on the screen.

name: saveWorker
description: The worker which is used during the saving process.

name: limitedEvaluate
description: An evaluator for strings as mathmatical equations which is sandboxed and secure.

name: widthToPixels
description: A function to generate a pixel value for 0-1 location on screen depending on screen width

name: pixelsToWidth
description: A function to generate a 0-1 value from pixels for location on screen depending on screen width

name: heightToPixels
description: A function to generate a pixel value for 0-1 location on screen depending on screen height

name: pixelsToHeight
description: A function to generate a 0-1 value from pixels for location on screen depending on screen height

name: generateUniqueID
description: A function to generate a unique ID value. Currently uses random which does not gurintee that it will be unique.

name: distBetweenPoints
description: Computes the distance between two points on a plane. This is a duplicate of the one in utils which should probably be deleted.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x cordinate of the first point.

params.name: x2
params.description: The x cordinate of the second point.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y cordinate of the first point.

params.name: y2
params.description: The y cordinate of the second point.

name: globalVariables
description: Because we want global variables to be the same every time it is imported we export an instance of global variables instead of the constructor.

name: src/js/molecules/assembly.js
Assembly
description: This class creates the Assembly atom instance.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new assembly atom.

params.name: values
params.description: An object of values. Each of these values will be applied to the resulting atom.

name: name
description: This atom's name

name: atomType
description: This atom's type

name: ioValues
description: A list of all of the inputs to this molecule. May be loaded when the molecule is created.

name: removeCutawayGeometry
description: A flag to determine if cutaway geometry is removed.

name: updateValue
description: Super class the default update value function. This function computes creates an array of all of the input values and then passes that array to a worker thread to create the assembly.

name: updateSidebar
description: Updates the side bar to add check boxes to turn on and off different elements.

name: serialize
description: Super class the default serialize function to save the inputs since this atom has variable numbers of inputs.

name: src/js/molecules/BOM.js
AddBOMTag

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values passed in which will be assigned to the class as this.x

name: atomType
description: This atom's type

name: type
description: This atom's type

name: name
description: This atom's name

name: BOMitem
description: The BOM item object created by this atom

name: updateValue
description: Set the value to be the BOMitem, then call super updateValue()

name: updateSidebar
description: Updates the side bar to display the BOM item information

name: draw
description: Add a B to the molecule representation

name: createBOM
description: Creates an editable UI represntation of the bom list.

params.name: list
params.description: list is an object to which the generated HTML element will be apended

name: serialize
description: Add the bom item to the saved object

Color

description: The color options to choose from

name: selectedColorIndex
description: The index of the currently selected color option.

description: Updates the value of the selected color and then the value.

description: Draw the constant which is more rectangular than the regular shape.

name: name
description: This atom's name

name: atomType
description: This atom's type

name: topLevel
description: A flag to signal if this node is the top level node

description: The color for the whole in the center of the drawing...probably doesn't need to be in this scope

description: This replaces the default Molecule double click behavior to prevent you from being able to double click into a github molecule

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description:
The y coordinate of the click
//

name: loadProjectByID
description: Loads a project into this GitHub molecule from github based on the passed github ID. This function is async and execution time depends on project complexity, and network speed.

params.name: id
params.description: The GitHub project ID for the project to be loaded.

name: updateSidebar
description: Updates sidebar with buttons for user in runMode

name: serialize
description: Save the project information to be loaded. This should use super.serialize() to maintain a connection with Molecule, but it doesn't...should be fixed

name: src/js/molecules/input.js
Input
description: This class creates the input atom.

name: constructor
description: The constructor function.

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values passed in which will be assigned to the class as this.x

name: name
description: This atom's name

name: value
description: The value the input is set to, defaults to 10. Is this still used or are we using the value of the attachmentPoint now?

name: atomType
description: This atom's type

name: height
description: This atom's height for drawing

name: radius
description: This atom's radius for drawing

name: oldName
description: This atom's old name, used during name changes

name: updateSidebar
description: Updates the side bar to let the user change the atom value. Note that the parent molecule input is set, not this atom's input by changes.

name: draw
description: Draws the atom on the screen.

name: color
description: This background color

name: strokeColor
description: This atoms accent color

name: deleteNode
description: Remove the input from the parent molecule, then delete the atom normally.

name: updateParentName
description: Called when the name has changed to updated the name of the parent molecule IO

name: updateValue
description: Grabs the new value from the parent molecule's input, sets this atoms value, then propogates. TODO: If the parent has nothing connected, check to see if something is tied to the default input.

name: getOutput
description: Returns the current value being output

name: src/js/molecules/molecule.js
Molecule
description: This class creates the Molecule atom.

name: constructor
description: The constructor function.

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values passed in which will be assigned to the class as this.x

name: nodesOnTheScreen
description: A list of all of the atoms within this Molecule which should be drawn on the screen.

name: inputs
description: An array of the molecules inputs. Is this not inherited from atom?

name: name
description: This atom's type

name: atomType
description: This atom's type

name: centerColor
description: The color for the middle dot in the molecule

name: topLevel
description: A flag to indicate if this molecule is the top level molecule.

name: runModeSidebarAdditions
description: A list of things which should be displayed on the the top level sideBar when in toplevel mode.

name: copyInputsFromParent
description: Gives this molecule inputs with the same names as all of it's parent's inputs

name: draw
description: Add the center dot to the molecule

name: doubleClick
description: Handle double clicks by replacing the molecule currently on the screen with this one, esentially diving into it.

params.name: x
params.description: The x cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The y cordinate of the click

name: backgroundClick
description: Handle a background click (a click which doesn't land on one of the contained molecules) by deselecting everything and displaying a 3D rendering of this molecules output.

name: selected
description: Flag that the attom is now selected.

name: deselect
description: Unselect this molecule

name: updateValue
description: Grab values from the inputs and push them out to the input atoms.

name: propogate
description: Trigger the output to propogate.

name: beginPropogation
description: Walks through each of the atoms in this molecule and begins propogation from them if they have no inputs to wait for

name: updateSidebar
description: Updates the side bar to display options like 'go to parent' and 'load a different project'. What is displayed depends on if this atom is the top level, and if we are using run mode.

name: createSegmentSlider
description: Creates segment length slider and passes value to Global Variables

name: refreshCircles
description: Used to trigger all of the circle atoms within a molecule and all of the molecules within it to update their value. Used when the number of segments changes.

name: displaySimpleBOM
description: Creates a simple BOM list which cannot be edited. The generated element is added to the passed list.

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to append the created element to.

name: displaySidebarReadme
description: Creates markdown version of the readme content for this atom in the sidebar

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to append the created element to.

name: goToParentMolecule
description: Replace the currently displayed molecule with the parent of this molecule...moves the user up one level.

name: requestReadme
description: Check to see if any of this molecules children have contributions to make to the README file. Children closer to the top left will be applied first. TODO: No contribution should be made if it's just a title.

name: serialize
description: Generates and returns a JSON represntation of this molecule and all of its children.

params.name: savedObject
params.description: A JSON object to append the represntation of this atom to.

name: deserialize
description: Load the children of this from a JSON represntation

params.name: moleculeList
params.description: A list of all the atoms to be placed

params.name: moleculeID
params.description: The uniqueID of the molecule from the list to be loaded

name: savedConnectors
description: A copy of the connectors attached to this molecule which can be reattached later. Should be redone.

name: dumpBuffer
description: Dump the stored copies of any geometry in this molecule to free up ram.

name: placeAtom
description: Places a new atom inside the molecule

params.name: newAtomObj
params.description: An object defining the new atom to be placed

params.name: moleculeList
params.description: Only pased if we are placing an instance of Molecule.

params.name: typesList
params.description: A dictionary of all of the available types with references to their constructors

params.name: unlock
params.description: A flag to indicate if this atom should spawn in the unlocked state.

name: placeConnector
description: Places a new connector within the molecule

params.name: connectorObj
params.description: An object represntation of the connector specifying its inputs and outputs.

name: sendToRender
description: Sends the output of this molecule to be displayed in the 3D view.

description: I believe this is no longer used alzatin - is that right?

description: Add the names of the inputs to the saved object so that they can be loaded later

name: src/js/NewMenu.js
ele
description: Html element that cointains the circular menu

name: makeArray
description: Runs to create submenus from Global Variables atomCategories. Populates menu objects

params.name: group
params.description: Name of the category to find appropriate atoms

name: githubList
description: List that contains results of gitHub search

name: showGitHubSearch
description: Runs when a gitHub molecule menu option is clicked to show search bar.

name: searchMenu
description: Runs when enter key is clicked and the input is focused to show results from search.

name: placeNewNode
description: Runs when a menu option is clicked to place a new atom from the local atoms list.

params.name: ev
params.description: The event triggered by click event on a menu item.

name: placeGitHubMolecule
description: Runs when a menu option is clicked to place a new atom from searching on GitHub.

params.name: ev
params.description: The event triggered by clicking on a menu item.

name: cmenu
description: This creates a new instance of the circular menu.

name: src/js/prototypes/atom.js
Atom
description: This class is the prototype for all atoms.

name: constructor
description: The constructor function.

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values passed in which will be assigned to the class as this.x

name: inputs
description: An array of all of the input attachment points connected to this atom

name: output
description: This atom's output attachment point if it has one

name: x
description: The X cordinate of this atom

name: y
description: The Y cordinate of this atom

name: radius
description: This atom's radius as displayed on the screen is 1/72 width

name: defaultColor
description: This atom's default color (ie when not selected or processing)

name: selectedColor
description: The color to use for strokes when selected

name: strokeColor
description: The color currently used for strokes

name: selected
description: A flag to indicate if this atom is curently selected

name: color
description: This atom's curent color

name: name
description: This atom's name

name: parentMolecule
description: This atom's parent, usually the molecule which contains this atom

name: value
description: This atom's value...Is can this be done away with? Are we basically storing the value in the output now?

name: isMoving
description: A flag to indicate if this atom is currently being draged on the screen.

name: showHover
description: A flag to indicate if we are hovering over this atom.

name: alertMessage
description: A warning message displayed next to the atom. Put text in here to have a warning automatically show up. Cleared each time the output is regenerated.

name: processing
description: A flag to indicate if the atom is currently computing a new output. Turns the molecule blue.

name: [key]
description: Assign each of the values in values as this.value

name: setValues
description: Applies each of the passed values to this as this.x

params.name: values
params.description: A list of values to set

name: draw
description: Draws the atom on the screen

name: addIO
description: Adds a new attachment point to this atom

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the IO (input or output)

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new attachment point

params.name: target
params.description: The attom to attach the new attachment point to. Should we force this to always be this one?

params.name: valueType
params.description: Describes the type of value the input is expecting options are number, geometry, array

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: The default value to be used when the value is not yet set

name: removeIO
description: Removes an attachment point from an atom.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the IO (input or output).

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new attachment point.

params.name: target
params.description: The attom which the attachment point is attached to. Should this be forced to be this.?

name: setAlert
description: Set an alert to display next to the atom.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to display.

name: clearAlert
description: Clears the alert message attached to this atom.

name: clickDown
description: Set the atom's response to a mouse click. This usually means selecting the atom and displaying it's contents in 3D

params.name: x
params.description: The X cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The Y cordinate of the click

params.name: clickProcessed
params.description: A flag to indicate if the click has already been processed

name: doubleClick
description: Set the atom's response to a mouse double click. By default this isn't to do anything other than mark the double click as handled.

params.name: x
params.description: The X cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The Y cordinate of the click

name: clickUp
description: Set the atom's response to a mouse click up. If the atom is moving this makes it stop moving.

params.name: x
params.description: The X cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The Y cordinate of the click

name: clickMove
description: Set the atom's response to a mouse click and drag. Moves the atom around the screen.

params.name: x
params.description: The X cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The Y cordinate of the click

name: keyPress
description: Set the atom's response to a key press. Is used to delete the atom if it is selected.

params.name: key
params.description: The key which has been pressed.

name: updateSidebar
description: Updates the side bar to display information about the atom. By default this is just add a title and to let you edit any unconnected inputs.

name: initializeSideBar
description: Initialized the sidebar with a title and create the HTML object.

name: deleteNode
description: Delete this atom.

name: update
description: Runs with each frame to draw the atom.

name: copySelected
description: Save JSON string with information about this atom that we want to save and copy.

name: pasteSelected
description: Paste new copied atom into screen.

name: serialize
description: Create an object containing the information about this atom that we want to save.

name: requestReadme
description: Return any contribution from this atom to the README file

name: updateValue
description: Set's the output value and shows the atom output on the 3D view.

name: displayAndPropogate
description: Displays the atom in 3D and sets the output.

name: basicThreadValueProcessing
description: Calls a worker thread to compute the atom's value.

name: waitOnComingInformation
description: This locks all the inputs downstream of this which will need to wait for it to update

name: beginPropogation
description: Unlocks the atom by checking to see if it has any upstream components that it should wait for before beginning to process.

name: sendToRender
description: Send the value of this atom to the 3D display.

name: findIOValue
description: Find the value of an input for with a given name.

params.name: ioName
params.description: The name of the target attachment point.

name: dumpBuffer
description: Dump the stored copies of any geometry in this atom to free up ram.

name: createEditableValueListItem
description: Creates an editable HTML item to set the value of an object element. Used in the sidebar.

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to attach the new item to.

params.name: object
params.description: The object with the element we are editing.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the element to edit.

params.name: label
params.description: The label to display next to the editable value.

params.name: resultShouldBeNumber
params.description: A flag to indicate if the input should be converted to a number.

params.name: callBack
params.description: Optional. A function to call with the new value when the value changes.

name: createNonEditableValueListItem
description: Creates an non-editable HTML item to set the value of an object element. Used in the sidebar.

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to attach the new item to.

params.name: object
params.description: The object with the element we are displaying.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the element to display.

params.name: label
params.description: The label to display next to the displayed value.

name: createMarkdownListItem
description: Creates a html representation of the passed text. Used in the sidebar.

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to attach the new item to.

params.name: texxt
params.description: The text used to generate the markdown html.

name: createDropDown
description: Creates dropdown with multiple options to select. Used in the sidebar.

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to attach the new item to.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent which has the function to call on the change...this should really be done with a callback function.

params.name: options
params.description: A list of options to display in the drop down.

params.name: selectedOption
params.description: The zero referenced index of the selected option.

params.name: description
params.description: A description of what the dropdown does.

params.name: Callback
params.description: function

name: createButton
description: Creates button. Used in the sidebar.

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to attach the new item to.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent which has the function to call on the change...this should really be done with a callback function.

params.name: buttonText
params.description: The text on the button.

params.name: functionToCall
params.description: The function to call when the button is pressed.

name: createCheckbox
description: Creates button. Used in the sidebar.

params.name: list
params.description: The HTML object to attach the new item to.

params.name: buttonText
params.description: The text on the button.
Flag to see if checkbox is checked

params.name: functionToCall
params.description: The function to call when the button is pressed.

name: src/js/prototypes/attachmentpoint.js
AttachmentPoint
description: This class creates a new attachmentPoint which are the input and output blobs on Atoms

name: constructor
description: The constructor function.

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values passed in which will be assigned to the class as this.x

name: defaultRadius
description: This atom's default radius (non hover)

name: expandedRadius
description: A flag to indicate if this attachmet point is currently expanded.

name: radius
description: This atom's current radius as displayed.

name: hoverOffsetX
description: When the mouse is hovering where should the AP move in X

name: hoverOffsetY
description: When the mouse is hovering where should the AP move in Y

name: uniqueID
description: A unique identifying number for this attachment point

name: defaultOffsetX
description: The default offset position in X referenced to the center of the parent atom.

name: defaultOffsetY
description: The default offset position in Y referenced to the center of the parent atom.

name: offsetX
description: The current offset position in X referenced to the center of the parent atom.

name: offsetY
description: The current offset position in Y referenced to the center of the parent atom.

name: showHoverText
description: A flag to determine if the hover text is shown next to the attachment point.

name: atomType
description: The attachment point type.

name: valueType
description: The attachment point value type. Options are number, geometry, array.

name: type
description: The attachment point type. Options are input, output.

name: primary
description:
This is a flag to indicate if the attachment point is of the primary type.
Primary type inputs are of the form geometry.translate(input2, input3, input4) for example
This value is useful for importing molecules into other formats.

name: value
description: The attachment point current value.

name: defaultValue
description: The default value to be used by the ap when nothing is attached

name: ready
description: A flag to indicate if the attachment point is currently ready. Used to order initilization when program is loaded.

name: connectors
description: A list of all of the connectors attached to this attachmet point

name: [key]
description: Assign values in values as this.x

name: draw
description: Draws the attachment point on the screen. Called with each frame.

name: clickDown
description: Handles mouse click down. If the click is inside the AP it's connectors are selected if it is an input.

params.name: x
params.description: The x cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The y cordinate of the click

params.name: clickProcessed
params.description: Has the click already been handled

name: clickUp
description: Handles mouse click up. If the click is inside the AP and a connector is currently extending, then a connection is made

params.name: x
params.description: The x cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The y cordinate of the click

name: clickMove
description: Handles mouse click and move to expand the AP. Could this be done with a call to expand out?

params.name: x
params.description: The x cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The y cordinate of the click

name: reset
description: I'm not sure what this does. Can it be deleted?

name: expandOut
description: Handles mouse click down. If the click is inside the AP it's connectors are selected if it is an input.

params.name: cursorDistance
params.description: The distance the cursor is from the attachment point.

name: keyPress
description: Just passes a key press to the attached connectors. No impact on the connector.

params.name: key
params.description: The key which was pressed

name: deleteSelf
description: Delete any connectors attached to this ap

name: deleteConnector
description: Delete a target connector which is passed in. The default option is to delete all of the connectors.

name: wasConnectionMade
description: Can be called to see if the target cordinates are within this ap. Returns true/false.

params.name: x
params.description: The x cordinate of the target

params.name: y
params.description: The y cordinate of the target

name: attach
description: Attaches a new connector to this ap

params.name: connector
params.description: The connector to attach

name: waitOnComingInformation
description: Passes a lock command to the parent molecule, or to the attached connector depending on input/output.

name: setDefault
description: Restores the ap to it's default value.

name: updateDefault
description: Updates the default value for the ap.

name: getValue
description: Reads and returns the current value of the ap.

name: setValue
description: Sets the current value of the ap.

name: dumpBuffer
description: Clears any references to geometry this ap is holding onto to free up ram.

name: update
description: Computes the curent position and then draws the ap on the screen.

name: src/js/prototypes/connector.js
Connector
description: The connector class defines how an output can be connected to an input. It appears on the screen as a black line extending from an output to an input.

name: constructor
description: The constructor function.

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values passed in which will be assigned to the class as this.x

name: isMoving
description: True if the connector is currently being created and is in the process of extending

name: color
description: The connectors current color

name: atomType
description: The type of this connector

name: selected
description: True if this connector has been selected

name: attachmentPoint1
description: The first attachment point this connector is connected to (an ouput)

name: attachmentPoint2
description: The second attachment point this connector is connected to (an input)

name: [key]
description: Assign each of the values in values as this.key

name: startX
description: The starting X cordinate for the connector. Should really be referenced to attachmentPoint1.

name: startY
description: The starting Y cordinate for the connector. Should really be referenced to attachmentPoint1.

name: draw
description: Draw the connector as a bezier curve on the screen

name: clickUp
description: clickUp checks to see if the mouse button has been released over an input attachment point. If it has then the connector is created there. If not, then the connector is deleted.

params.name: x
params.description: The x cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The y cordinate of the click

name: clickMove
description: clickMove runs while the connector is being created. As long as the mouse is pressed down, the end of the connector stays attached to the mouse.

params.name: x
params.description: The x cordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: The y cordinate of the click

name: endX
description: The s cordinate of the end of the connector.

name: endY
description: The y cordinate of the end of the connector.

name: keyPress
description: Called when any key is pressed. If the key is delete or backspace and the connector is selected then the connector is deleted.

params.name: key
params.description: The key which was pressed

name: deleteSelf
description: Deletes the connector by calling its attachmentPoints to tell them to delete their references to this connector.

name: serialize
description: Generates an object used to save the connector.

name: waitOnComingInformation
description: Passes a lock call to the connected input.

name: propogate
description: Pass the value of the attached output to the attached input

name: update
description: Commputes the connectors position and draw it to the screen.

name: src/utils.js
randomIntFromRange
description: Returns a randome integer within a range.

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum possible value.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum possible value.

name: randomColor
description: Selects a random color from an array. Where is this used? Can this be deleted?

params.name: colors
params.description: An array of possible colors.

name: distance
description: Compute the distance between two points on a plane.

params.name: x1
params.description: The x cordinate of the first point.

params.name: y1
params.description: The y cordinate of the first point.

params.name: x2
params.description: The x cordinate of the second point.

params.name: y2
params.description: The y cordinate of the second point.

content:
# A web based CAD program for cooperative design.

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/MaslowCNC/Maslow-Create.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/MaslowCNC/Maslow-Create)
[![Documentation](https://maslowcreate.org/documentation/badge.svg)](https://maslowcreate.org/documentation/)
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/github/MaslowCNC/Maslow-Create/badge.svg?branch=master)](https://coveralls.io/github/MaslowCNC/Maslow-Create?branch=master)


![overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/master/MaslowCreate.png)

Maslow create breaks with the tradition of CAD programs which inherit from drawing programs and instead inherits from logical languages like programing. This allows it to be a CAD program which has language like features such as importing modules, version control, and colaboration.

# Use

A 3D model within Maslow Create is composed of interconnected nodes called Atoms and Molecules. An atom is an operation you can perform on a shape (ie translate it in space). A molecule can contain any number of atoms in a configuration (ie generate a table leg). Think of Atoms as the built in functions of a programing language and molecules as the functions you create.

You can place a new atom by right clicking anywhere within the flow canvas area and entering an atom name in the search bar.

Currently Maslow Create supports the folowing atoms:

### Assembly 

The assembly atom allows multiple shapes to be combigned into one unit called an assembly. The order in which atoms are combigned matters because where shapes intersect shapes earlier in the order subtract from shapes later in the order. For example if you have a bolt which needs to create a hole in a part you should assemble first the part and then the bolt.

![assembly](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/master/images/Assembly.PNG)

### Add BOM Tag

The Add BOM Tag atom tags a part with a bill of materials item. This item will appear in the project bill of materials one time each time the tagged part appears in the final shape. For example if you have a table leg which needs four bolts, and the final model has four table legs the bolt will automatically appear in the final bill of materials 16 times.

{picture of tag}
{picture of BOM file}

### Circle

The circle atom creates a circle shape. Circle shapes are commonly extruded to create cylinders.

![circle](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/master/images/Circle.PNG)

### Code

The code atom allows you to enter arbitrary [jsxcad](https://jsxcad.js.org/) code. Please note that parts of this interface are likely to change in the near future.

### Constant

The constant atom defines a constant number which can be used to control multiple inputs.

{picture of constant controling multiple inputs}

### Difference

The difference atom subtracts one shape from another.

![difference](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/master/images/Difference.PNG)

### Equation 

The equation Atom lets you perform basic math operations on numbers produced by constants.

{Show equation doing something}

### Extrude 

The extrude atom takes a 2D shape and makes it 3D.

![extrude](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/master/images/Extrude.PNG)

### Gcode

The gcode atom generates gcode to cut the input shape.

![Gcode1](https://github.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/blob/master/images/Gcode1.PNG)
![Gcode2](https://github.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/blob/master/images/Gcode2.PNG)

### GitHub

The GitHub atom type is not directly available. By clicking on the GitHub tab when placing a new Atom you can search for and add any other Maslow Create project to your project.

### Input

The input atom lets you define which variables are inputs to your program. They function similar to constants, however when you share your project, the person on the other end will have the ability to change the values of the inputs. Inputs placed within a molecule will add inputs to that molecule up one level.

{picture of project being shared}

### Intersection

The intersection atom computes the area of intersection of two shapes and creates a new shape out of that area.

{picture of intersection}

### Molecule

The molecule atom can contain any number of atoms in a useful configuration. To add inputs to the molecule, place an input atom within it.

{picture of molecule}

### Output

The output atom cannot be directly placed, however each molecule has one output which cannot be delted. Connect a shape to the output of a molecule to make that shape available one level up. The output of the top level molecule is the output of the project.

![output](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/master/images/Output.PNG)

### README

The README atom provides notes to the next person reading the project. The text of the readme input is added to the readme page of the project (similar to this page you are reading now).

{Show readme atom}

### Rectangle

The rectangle atom creates a rectangle shape. Rectangles are commonly extruded to make a 3D shape.

{show picture of rectangle}

### Regular Polygon

The regular polygon atom creates a regular polygon shape. Regular polygons are regularly extruded to create a 3D shape.

![regular polygon](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create/master/images/RegularPolygon.PNG)

### Rotate

The rotate atom rotates a shape along any of it's three axis.

{picture of rotate}

### Scale

The scale atom scales a shape evenly in all directions.

{picture of scale}

### Shrinkwrap

The shrinkwrap atom combines multiple shapes into a single shape as if they had been shrinkwrapped. This is useful for creating shapes which would be dificult to create in other ways.

{picture of shrinkwrap}

### Stretch

The stretch atom stretches a shape along any of its axis.

{picture of stretch}

### Tag

The tag atom adds a tag to a part which can be later used to retrieve that part from an assembly.

### Translate

The translate atom moves a 3D shape in 3D space or a 2D shape in 2D space.

{picture of translate}

### Union

The union atom combines multiple shapes into a single shape.

{picture of union}


# Development

You can read the complete documentation at [https://maslowcreate.org/documentation/](https://maslowcreate.org/documentation/)

## How To Setup

1.  Clone the repo:

        git clone https://github.com/BarbourSmith/Maslow-Create.git

2.  Install dependencies:

        npm install

3.  Run webpack:

        npm start

Your canvas piece should open up automatically at http://localhost:3000 and you should see 'HTML CANVAS BOILERPLATE' on hover.

## Layout of the program

Maslow Create has three main areas of the interface. Along the top of the screen is the logical flow of the design. In the lower left is a 3D rendering of the design, and in the lower right is the side bar which displays information related to the currently selected atom. If no atom is selected, then information about the open molecule is displayed.

The logical flow of the design is composed of nodes called Atoms which are connected by connectors. Each atom has a number of attachment points where connectors can connect. Each atom type inherits from the atom class which is defined in the file `/dist/js/molecules/prototypes.js`. Each atom type then has it's own file which modifies the behavior of the default atom class.

The lower left 3D rendring is an instance of the JSCAD project. It is currently a hacked version of 1.x while waiting for version 2 to be released. Right now the generated code is done through string manipulation. In version 2 we will pass actual JS objects to functions.

The lower right corner of the screen is called the "Side Bar" It contains information about the currently selected atom. It is populated by that atom's "Generate Sidebar" function.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "canvas-template",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "",
  "main": "webpack.config.js",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "webpack --config webpack.config.js",
    "build": "webpack --config webpack-build.config.js",
    "test": "nyc --reporter=html --reporter=text mocha -r jsdom-global/register -r esm",
    "lint": "eslint --ignore-path .eslintignore .",
    "doc": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc",
    "coverage": "nyc report --reporter=text-lcov | coveralls"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "",
  "license": "ISC",
  "dependencies": {
    "@octokit/rest": "16.25.0",
    "codemirror": "^5.46.0",
